intro: Pleiogyne microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed pleiogyne, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
